title: OYO revises rules in this city, unmarried couples won't be allowed to check-in - Hindustan Times
summary:
OYO Imposes New Check-in Rules for Unmarried Couples in Meerut

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

OYO has introduced a new policy in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, which prohibits unmarried couples from checking into hotels. This policy requires all couples to provide valid proof of their relationship during check-in.

  • New check-in policy effective in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh.
  • All couples must provide proof of relationship at check-in, regardless of reservations.
  • Policy implemented based on feedback from civil society groups.
  • May extend to other cities depending on response.
"OYO aims to transform its outdated perceptions and provide a safe experience for families and other travelers." - Pawas Sharma, Region Head, OYO North India.

This new policy by OYO reflects its response to requests for increased regulation on hotel check-ins for unmarried couples.
newTitle: OYO Imposes New Check-in Rules for Unmarried Couples in Meerut

title: Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Several flights and trains have been delayed in Delhi due to dense fog conditions that have reduced visibility. The mercury has dipped to 10°C amid these weather disruptions.

  • Dense fog resulted in significant delays for flights and train services.
  • Temperature in Delhi has fallen to 10°C.
  • Authorities are advising travelers to check the status of their services before heading out.
"Travelers are advised to remain updated on flight and train status due to ongoing delays."

This weather condition has caused inconvenience for many travelers, prompting officials to issue warnings and advisories.
newTitle: Delhi Flights and Trains Delayed Due to Dense Fog

title: BJP MLA claims ‘50,000 cows slaughtered daily in Uttar Pradesh’, accuses govt of silence - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP MLA Claims 50,000 Cows Slaughtered Daily in Uttar Pradesh

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA Nand Kishore Gujar has alleged that the Yogi Adityanath government is complicit in the daily slaughter of 50,000 cows in Uttar Pradesh, expressing concerns over official corruption and urging resolution at the highest levels.

  • Nand Kishore Gujar claims 50,000 cows are slaughtered every day under the current government.
  • He alleges that corrupt officials are misusing funds meant for cow welfare.
  • Gujar expresses frustration over the lack of government action on this issue.
  • He warns that unchecked corruption could affect the BJP's performance in the upcoming elections.
  • Akhilesh Yadav criticizes BJP infighting and its impact on public interests.
  • A separate incident highlights a lynching in Moradabad linked to cow slaughter accusations.
“If action is taken against these corrupt officials, the BJP could win as many as 375 seats in the next assembly elections.”

The claims by MLA Gujar shed light on serious allegations against officials in Uttar Pradesh, raising questions regarding animal welfare and government accountability.
newTitle: BJP MLA Claims 50,000 Cows Slaughtered Daily in Uttar Pradesh

title: 4 Maoists Gunned Down, 1 Security Personnel Dies In Chhattisgarh Encounter - NDTV
summary:
Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

An encounter between Maoists and security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of four Maoists and one security personnel. The clash occurred during an anti-Maoist operation in the forests of Narayanpur and Dantewada districts.

  • Four Maoists were killed during a face-off with security personnel.
  • One head constable from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) named Sannu Karam lost his life.
  • Security forces were conducting an anti-Maoist operation when the encounter took place.
  • After the exchange of fire, bodies of the Maoists and their weapons were recovered.
  • In 2024, over 200 Maoists have been killed, with a focus on eradicating this insurgency by March 2026.
  • 18 security personnel have reportedly died in anti-Maoist operations this year, alongside 65 civilians due to Maoist violence.
“Amit Shah vowing to eradicate them by March 2026.”

The ongoing operations highlight the persistent conflict between security forces and Maoist insurgents in the region, with the government emphasizing its commitment to restoring peace.
newTitle: Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

title: Four Naxalites, cop killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada - The Hindu
summary:
Four Naxalites, cop killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Four Naxalites were killed in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Bastar region, along with a head constable of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) who also lost his life.

  • The gunfight occurred on Saturday evening in a forest area during an anti-Naxalite operation.
  • Bodies of the Naxalites and their weapons, including AK-47s, were recovered at the scene.
  • Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai pledged to continue the fight against Naxalism.
  • In 2024, 219 Naxalites were neutralized in such encounters throughout the state.
“His sacrifice will not go in vain. Security forces have been fighting very strongly against Naxalism.” - Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

This encounter highlights the ongoing struggle between security forces and Naxalite groups in the region, aiming for greater stability and safety.
newTitle: Four Naxalites and a Police Officer Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter

title: 'Total chaos': Pune-bound flyers spend over 7 hours in plane in Delhi - The Times of India
summary:
Pune-Bound Flyers Experience 7 Hour Delay in Delhi

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Passengers traveling from Delhi to Pune faced significant delays, spending more than 7 hours on the tarmac due to operational issues.

  • Flight delays were caused by severe weather and operational failures.
  • Passengers reported a lack of communication and support from airline staff during the extensive wait.
  • Many travelers expressed frustration and voiced their concerns over safety and comfort in such situations.
  • Airlines are being urged to improve contingency planning to avoid future disruptions.
“We felt abandoned on the plane without any updates,” said one passenger.

This incident highlights the challenges faced by airlines and passengers during unexpected delays and the need for better management in the aviation sector.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate 13-km Delhi section of Namo Bharat corridor today - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi to Inaugurate 13-km Delhi Section of Namo Bharat Corridor Today

Published on: January 05, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate a 13-km section of the Namo Bharat corridor, enhancing connectivity between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar.

  • The inauguration is scheduled for 11 a.m., with train services starting at 5 p.m.
  • The fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South will be ₹150 for a standard coach and ₹225 for a premium coach.
  • This section includes 6 km of underground rail and has a prominent station at Anand Vihar.
  • Train operations will reduce travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South to around 40 minutes.
  • The project aims to ease congestion by removing over 100,000 private vehicles from roads.
“Namo Bharat trains have served over 50 lakh commuters to date.”

The inauguration marks a significant expansion of the Namo Bharat project, providing direct connectivity to Meerut from Delhi.
newTitle: PM Modi to Launch New Section of Namo Bharat Corridor in Delhi

title: Ex-Armymen arrested after 19 years for killing 17-day-old twins and their mother - Hindustan Times

summary:
PM Modi to Launch Major Development Projects Worth Over ₹12,000 Crore in Delhi

Date: Jan 05, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of multiple development projects, totaling over ₹12,000 crore, in Delhi today, including the first section of the rapid transit system connecting Ghaziabad and Delhi.

  • Inauguration of a 13 km stretch from Sahibabad to New Ashok Nagar worth ₹4,600 crore.
  • Ride in the Namo Bharat train between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar.
  • Opening of a 2.8 km stretch of Delhi Metro Phase-IV between Janakpuri and Krishna Park worth ₹1,200 crore.
  • Laying foundation for the 26.5 km Rithala-Kundli section of Delhi Metro Phase-IV, costing approximately ₹6,230 crore.
  • New building for the Central Ayurveda Research Institute at a cost of ₹185 crore, improving healthcare infrastructure in Rohini.
“The projects will significantly enhance connectivity and provide state-of-the-art healthcare facilities.”

Today’s inauguration marks a significant step towards improving infrastructure in Delhi and enhancing the rapid transit system in the region.

Ancient warship wreck found by Lakshadweep divers near Kalpeni Island: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ancient Warship Wreck Discovered Near Lakshadweep Island

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A group of divers discovered what appears to be the wreck of a European warship from the 17th or 18th century while exploring marine life near Kalpeni Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago.

  • The wreck is believed to belong to one of three European nations: Portuguese, Dutch, or British.
  • This is the first such discovery in the region.
  • The wreckage provides a historical link to maritime conflicts over trade routes in the 17th and 18th centuries.
  • The presence of a cannon suggests it was a warship, possibly made of iron and wood.
“When we spotted the wreck... we realized it could be an important find,” said Satyajeet Mane, a marine explorer.

This remarkable discovery highlights the need for further underwater archaeological studies to uncover more about the ship and protect the site.
newTitle: Ancient Warship Wreck Discovered Near Lakshadweep Island

title: Press Council seeks report from Chhattisgarh govt on Bastar journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder - The Hindu
summary:
Press Council seeks report from Chhattisgarh govt on Bastar journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder

Published on: January 05, 2025 06:44 am IST, Source: The Hindu

The Press Council of India has expressed concern over the suspected murder of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar and has called for a report from the Chhattisgarh state government.

Mukesh Chandrakar, a freelance journalist in Bastar, was reported missing on January 1, with his body found later in a septic tank. Actions have led to the arrest of three individuals connected to the case, and a Special Investigation Team has been set up to investigate.

  • The PCI expressed concern and sought details from the state government.
  • Chandrakar's body was found in a septic tank owned by a suspect.
  • Three arrests have been made, including family members of the victim.
  • An argument over construction work is believed to be the motive behind the murder.
  • Protests were held by journalists demanding justice.
“Why is corruption of Suresh Chandrakar exposed by Mukesh not being discussed?” - Sushil Anand Shukla, Congress communication wing chief.

In conclusion, the incident highlights the dangers faced by journalists in the region and raises concerns about the safety and integrity of the media in Chhattisgarh.
newTitle: Press Council Requests Report on Chhattisgarh Journalist's Murder

title: Dallewal vows fight to finish, asks farmers of other states to join stir - The Tribune India

summary:
Kejriwal Promises to Waive Water Bills Amid Punjab Protests

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

During a recent protest by Punjab women outside Arvind Kejriwal's home, he promised that inflated water bills would be waived off if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) returns to power in Delhi.

  • Kejriwal claims that Congress and BJP should formally announce their collaboration in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.
  • He suggests that the recent inflated water bills are a result of interference by the BJP while he was in jail.
  • The AAP leader assures the public that those unfairly charged on water bills should refrain from paying until elections.
  • Punjab women protest against AAP's unfulfilled promises, demanding clarity on their financial assistance scheme.
  • Criticism arises from Congress and BJP regarding AAP's promises and governance track record.
“We have come from Amritsar to put forward our matters. Do not cheat the women of Delhi as you did with the women of Punjab,” said a protesting woman.

Kejriwal's statements come as the assembly elections approach, with polling expected in February 2025.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises to Waive Water Bills Amid Punjab Protests

title: Dr R Chidambaram (1936-2025): LIGO to Ayurveda, ‘nuclear man’ believed in research to solve societal problems - The Indian Express
summary:
Dr R Chidambaram (1936-2025): LIGO to Ayurveda, ‘nuclear man’ believed in research to solve societal problems

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Indian Express

Dr R Chidambaram, who passed away in Mumbai, is remembered for his significant contributions to India’s nuclear program and various scientific initiatives aimed at economic development.

  • Principal Scientific Advisor from 2001 to 2018, Chidambaram played a crucial role in establishing the National Knowledge Network.
  • Supported major science projects, including the National Supercomputing Mission and LIGO India.
  • Advocated for cleaner energy development and research in Ayurveda.
  • Believed in directed research aimed at solving societal problems.
  • Co-authored a book emphasizing the link between national development and security.
“I have always said that national development and national security are two sides of the same coin.”

In conclusion, Chidambaram's legacy as a versatile scientist who believed in addressing societal needs through research will be cherished by future generations.
newTitle: Dr R Chidambaram (1936-2025): Pioneering Scientist Who Blended Nuclear Research with Ayurveda

title: Naharlagun police achieve significant milestone in combating drug-related offences - The Arunachal Times
summary:
Naharlagun Police Combat Drug Offences with Operation Dawn

Date: 4 Jan Source: Naharlagun

The Naharlagun police have made significant strides in fighting drug-related crimes during 2024, resulting in numerous arrests and seizures.

Key Points:

  • 97 drug peddlers arrested and 7,912.73 gms of drugs seized in 2024.
  • 41 cases under the NDPS Act registered, up from 18 in 2023.
  • Operation Dawn led to a 43% reduction in theft and burglary incidents.
  • Extensive awareness campaigns have motivated individuals towards de-addiction treatment.
“Operation Dawn has not only curtailed the supply of illicit drugs but also saved countless youths from falling into addiction.” - Naharlagun SP Mihin Gambo

The Naharlagun police's proactive measures have not only curtailed drug trafficking but have also made the community safer.

Push to protect children online faces basic challenges: Experts - Hindustan Times
summary:
Push to protect children online faces basic challenges: Experts

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

India's draft Digital Personal Data Protection Rules aim to safeguard children's online privacy but face significant challenges regarding age verification and parental consent.

  • The rules mandate parental consent for users under 18.
  • Verification of guardians' identities is required but not clearly defined.
  • Experts express concerns over children's ability to self-declare their age accurately.
  • Concerns are raised regarding the digital literacy of parents compared to children.
  • Exemptions in the rules could lead to broader issues regarding ad targeting and data monetization.
“The fundamental question is - what happens if I don’t give my correct age? How will the entire mechanism work?” - Gowree Gokhale

The framework for protecting children online is ambitious but may struggle with implementation, particularly in a digital environment where age verification is complex.
newTitle: Experts Warn of Challenges in India's Online Child Protection Efforts

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Delhi RRTS stretch today - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi Inaugurates Delhi RRTS Stretch Connecting to Meerut

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13km section of the Rapid Regional Transit System (RRTS) establishing a vital link between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar in Delhi, which will enhance regional connectivity, particularly with Meerut.

  • The new RRTS line connects Delhi with Meerut, improving travel times significantly.
  • The stretch will be available for public use starting from 5 PM on inauguration day.
  • Namo Bharat trains will operate with a frequency of 15 minutes.
  • Standard fares range from ₹20 to ₹150 while premium fares are between ₹30 and ₹225.
  • The total RRTS corridor will cover 82 km, with an expected completion date of mid-2025.
  • Facilities at stations include wheelchair access and reserved seating for women and the elderly.
“With this inauguration, RRTS trains will now arrive in Delhi, ushering in a new chapter of high-speed mobility options for the national Capital boosting regional connectivity.” - Puneet Vats, NCRTC Spokesperson

In conclusion, this RRTS expansion is set to revolutionize transport between Delhi and Meerut, greatly benefiting commuters and boosting regional development.
newTitle: PM Modi Inaugurates Delhi RRTS Stretch Connecting to Meerut

title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
summary:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks reflect ongoing government efforts to enhance rural infrastructure and economic stability, aiming for a 'Viksit Bharat' (Developed India) by 2047.
newTitle: PM Modi Highlights Government Initiatives Transforming Rural India

title: 2 Ex-Armymen Killed Woman, 17-Day-Old Twins And Hid For 19 Years; Arrested - NDTV
summary:
Army Deserters Arrested After 19 Years for Killing Woman and 17-Day-Old Twins

Date & Source: Published on 2022-01-14, News18

Introduction: Two former Indian Army men were arrested in Kochi on Saturday, 15 years after they allegedly murdered a 24-year-old woman and her 17-day-old twin daughters in Kerala's Kollam district. The duo, who were serving in the Army at the time, went into hiding and managed to evade the law for nearly two decades.

  1. Dibil Kumar B and Rajesh P, both from the Indian Army's 45 AD Regiment in Pathankot, were accused of murdering Ranjini and her twin daughters in February 2006.
  2. The woman's mother discovered the bodies upon returning from the panchayat office, where she had gone to get the twins' birth certificates.
  3. Kumar was in a relationship with Ranjini but began distancing himself after the twins were born, leading to a paternity test order by the Kerala State Women's Commission.
  4. CBI arrested Kumar and Rajesh on Friday after they had been living under fake names in Puducherry with new families.
"After years of pursuit, the CBI received a tip-off that Kumar and Rajesh were living in Puducherry under fake names and had managed to get new documents made, including Aadhaar cards. They had reportedly married two teachers in the city and had also fathered children." - CBI officials

Conclusion: The accused have been remanded in police custody until January 18, and the CBI will seek their custody for further investigation.
newTitle: Army Deserters Arrested After 19 Years for Killing Woman and 17-Day-Old Twins

title: Manipur Governor suggests use of NSA against miscreants in Manipur, stresses on employment opportunities for youth - The Hindu
summary:
Manipur Governor Advocates for NSA Usage and Youth Employment Initiatives

Published on: January 04, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla has suggested the use of the National Security Act against miscreants during a security review meeting, emphasizing the need to address the concerns of the youth in the region.

  • Governor Bhalla recommended invoking the National Security Act against troublemakers in Manipur.
  • He called for creating employment opportunities for youth to mitigate unrest.
  • The meeting focused on security coordination among various armed forces in the state.
  • Ongoing violence linked to the United National Liberation Front and tensions in flashpoint areas like Yaingangpokpi were discussed.
  • Incidents of violence have increased, particularly following a protest that turned violent.
“Governor of Manipur, Ajay Kumar Bhalla, chaired security meeting at Raj Bhavan in Imphal, to review the state’s security and law and order situation, with a special focus on border areas.”

The Governor's initiatives aim to establish peace and stability in a region that has witnessed significant unrest and violence.
newTitle: Manipur Governor Advocates for NSA Usage and Youth Employment Initiatives

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar criticizes the previous government led by Lalu Prasad Yadav while rejecting an alliance offer, emphasizing Bihar's development since 2005.

  • Nitish Kumar attacks Lalu Prasad's government pre-2005, citing poor conditions in Bihar.

  • Lalu Yadav extended an invitation for partnership in the 'Mahagathbandan', but Kumar declined.

Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
summary:
Dense Fog Engulfs Delhi; Flight Operations Hit at IGI Airport

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Unknown

Nearly 500 flights faced disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to severe fog impacting northern India.

The dense fog has resulted in significant travel delays and cancellations, severely impacting air traffic across multiple states.

  • 412 flights delayed by over 45 minutes.
  • 45 flights cancelled due to poor weather conditions.
  • 19 flights diverted to alternate airports.
  • Zero visibility reported in New Delhi, especially between 11:30 p.m. and 8:30 a.m.
  • Intense fog conditions affected flights in multiple northern cities, including Chandigarh and Srinagar.
“Dense fog causing low visibility in northern belt continues to impact flight operations even during daytime hours,” - IndiGo.

This weather phenomenon underscores the ongoing challenges posed by extreme fog in the winter months, emphasizing the need for improved infrastructural responses to such disruptions.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi's IGI Airport
